title: Christine Lagarde and George Osborne warn on eurozone, as FTSE 100 slides again | Business | The Guardian
summary: ftse 100 slides to lowest close since october 2013
draghi : without eurozone reform there can be no recovery .
lagarde : serious risk of eurozone recession unless policymakers act .
lagarde : we think greece still needs 'precautionary support '
lagarde calls on us congress to ratify imf changes .
christine lagarde : it 's a brittle , mediocre recovery .

documents.title: closing summary
text: that 's all for tonight , after another day dominated by fears over the health of the global economy in general , and europe in particular .
a quick reminder of the key points : imf managing director christine lagarde has warned that the eurozone is seriously at risk of sliding into recession unless all countries , and the ecb , do more .
lagarde also signalled that she 'd like to see greece sign up to some 'precautionary support ' ( perhaps a credit line ? )
when its current bailout deal ends .
she was speaking as she outlined the imf 's global policy agenda , and warned that global growth remains brittle- highlights start here .

and here 's the imf 's priorities : graeme wearden ( @ graemewearden ) here are the imf 's new global policy agenda priorities : lagarde 's comments came on the day in which germany received its third dose of bad economic news this week .
exports tumbled by 5.8 % in august , in the biggest slump since january 2009 .
economists say germany will be lucky to avoid a recession .
uk chancellor george osborne added to the concerns swirling in europe , saying that the eurozone was already hurting britain 's economy .

and ecb chief mario draghi also weighed in , insisting that countries must reform in order to deliver a recovery he also gave germany a nudge , saying that countries with spare capacity to spend more should do so : mario draghi took a not-so-subtle swipe at germany without actually mentioning it by name and amid the pessimism , the ftse 100 fell to its lowest level since last october in other news the bank of england left interest rates unchanged again greece 's unemployment rate has fallen and it has also sunk deeper into deflation .
and a much-loved greek riot dog has died back tomorrow .
cheers , and goodnight .
gw
another gloomy signal tonight - brent crude oil has fallen below the $ 90 mark for the first time since 2012 , as global growth fears linger .
tim höfinghoff ( @ timhoefinghoff ) oil prices drop below $ 90 a barrel for the first time in over two years :
interesting discussion on twitter tonight about mario draghi 's claim that europe wo n't enjoy a recovery unless it implements reforms .
binyamin appelbaum ( @ bcappelbaum ) keynes once urged that recovery must precede reform .
draghi says that 's not possible today .
without reform , there can be no recovery . ''

former boe policymaker adam posen , and ft alan beattie , are not convinced : adam posen ( @ adamposen ) keynes right , draghi 's wrong about that @ twitterid alan beattie ( @ alanbeattie ) @ mark dow @ twitterid @ twitterid draghi ca n't possibly believe this , can he ?
surely just tactical to get germany to support abs purchases .

documents.title: ftse 100 slides to lowest close since october 2013
text: the ftse 100 has just closed at its lowest level in a year , as this morning 's early rally petered out .
the index of blue-chip shares fell 50 points to 6431 , a fall of 0.8 % , adding to recent losses .
fears over the global economy , and the ebola crisis , weighed on the city .
shares are also down on wall street , as yesterday 's revival unwinds .

cnbc now ( @ cnbcnow ) [ market update ] dow falls 175 points ; nasdaq and s & p fall approximately 1 % : some traders are expressing disappointment that mario draghi did n't hint at larger stimulus measures , in his speech this afternoon carl quintanilla ( @ carlquintanilla ) disappointment in draghi 's speech being cited among traders for the market dropoff .
dow down 190 .

@ twitterid alistair mccaig of ig says market optimism was squished by this morning 's weak german export figures : today 's german trade balance figures have confirmed , rather than confounded , the growing fears that rather than leading its fellow members into a healthier recovery , germany is being dragged ever closer to recession .
here 's nick fletcher 's latest market report : nick fletcher ( @ nickfletchergdn ) market forces live > ftse on course for lowest close for a year as early exuberance disappears

here 's a few more gems from germany 's finance minister , wolfgang schauble , who has been crossing swords with former us treasury secretary larry summers in washington : cnbcworld ( @ cnbcworld ) `` if germany starts telling italy what to do , we will be seen as arrogant we do n't want that ' : german fin min at cnbc debate # whatsnexteu louisa bojesen ( @ louisabojesen ) 'europe must not rely on assistance from the rest of the world'- german fin min schauble now on @ twitterid - # imf debate

documents.title: draghi : without eurozone reform there can be no recovery
text: elsewhere in washington , mario draghi is urging politicians to do their bit to help the recovery by implementing reforms and raising the 'growth potential ' of their econonomies .
the president of the european central bank is singing a familiar song , that monetary policy ca n't do it all alone .

here 's draghi 's key message : put simply , i can not see any way out of the crisis unless we create more confidence in the future potential of our economies '' given demographic trends , raising structural growth will have to take place primarily through productivity '' .
draghi warns that : without reform [ in the eurozone ] , there can be no recovery '' .
the ecb chief also warned that governments must also meet their commitments to fiscal reform - a warning to france that missing deficit targets would be dangerous .
so to now call into question not just the letter , but also the spirit of the fiscal governance framework would be self-defeating .
if this were to again cast doubt over fiscal sustainability , it would create a risk that borrowing costs , and hence fiscal policies , turn procyclical once more '' .
here 's some reaction to christine lagarde 's press conference in washington ( coverage starts here ) .
john gizzi , chief political columnist at newsmax , says us politicians are not happy about the idea of losing influence at the imf .
john gizzi ( @ johngizzi ) problem w. imf governance reforms mme .
lagarde promotes , congressional opponents say , is , they give china seat at table at loss of us .
but this chart shows why reform is needed : new rules coalition ( @ nrcoalition ) good reason why @ twitterid urges congress to pass imf reform .
# amcso14 # 188together @ twitterid @ twitterid lagarde 's comments on greece and the eurozone did n't get a universally positive response : fabrice pelosi ( @ fabricepelosi ) thanks for the tip .

rt @ twitterid : imf lagarde : serious risk of euro zone recession if nothing done - mni asteris masouras 正义 ( @ asteris ) greece to lagarde : we 're already in recession , largely thanks to the imf .
get real , drop bailausterity , talk debt abolition .
christine lagarde is now on cnbc ( that was quick !
) , warning that sierra leone 's economy will be hit hard by ebola .
jenny cosgrave ( @ jenny cosgrave ) imf 's lagarde : growth in sierra leone will be `` slashed '' to 3 % or 4 % at most after ebola outbreak @ twitterid
finally , christine lagarde says she 's looking forward to the imf 's next meeting in peru , where the economy had been struggling in recent months .
katerina sokou ( @ katerinasokou ) lagarde : risk of eurozone recession 35-40 % - it is avoidable , not necessarily a new japan but more to be done , monetary policy included
christine lagarde declines to comment on the merits of using 'purchasing power ' to measure china 's relative economic strength versus america .
the bottom line , she says , is that china is growing .

documents.title: lagarde : serious risk of eurozone recession unless policymakers act
text: q : how close is the eurozone to becoming the new japan , asks guardian economics editor larry elliott ?
we alerted , about a year ago , to the risk of persistent low inflation , says christine lagarde .
measures have been taken by the ecb to try and resist and reverse that risk .
more , we hope , will be done .
and we have now alerted the risk of recession in the eurozone .
we are not saying that the eurozone is heading to recession , but that there is a serious risk of that happening if the right things are not done .
the key is for both surplus and deficit '' countries to do what they have to do , she concludes .
katy barnato ( @ katybarnato ) imf 's christine lagarde : modest growth in euro zone is partly due to instability in ukraine
q : could there be dangerous spillovers , and spillbacks , when the us federal reserve raises interest rates ?
i can not predict what the fed will do , replies christine lagarde .
janet yellen is giving very clear guidance we can all see what she says .
and we can also see delivery of what she has messaged .
on spillovers the fed has studied the 'taper tantrum ' of 2013 , to avoid a repeat .
and yes , spillovers can lead to a spill-back of trouble to the country in question .
the imf has tweeted christine lagarde 's call on the us to ratify changes to the imf 's quotas .
imf ( @ imfnews ) lagarde : 2010 quota reform an absolute must .
# 188together
yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) # imf lagarde on q # greece : we think it would be better if the country has a precautionary line of credit to `` move on '' .
| # euro

documents.title: lagarde : we think greece still needs 'precautionary support '
text: now , a question on greece for imf managing director christine lagarde .
q : after four and a half years , the feeling is that we have had enough austerity and enough pain .
the pm has said today that a third bailout wo n't be needed , and has sent a team to washington .
so , can greece make it without the loans of the imf and the eu ?
christine lagarde replies that all countries , including greece '' must decide how they conduct their own finances .
we are very pleased that greece has improved its financial position , she says .
but we also believe that going forward , and to deliver a satisfactory environment , it would be in a better position if greece has precautionary support '' , she adds .
so we are talking about an evolution of the relationship '' , but one that will help the country to move on on its own , lagarde concludes .

sandrine rastello ( @ srastello ) @ lagarde says greece would be in better position with precautionary support after # imf loan when asked about potential exit cigolo ( @ cigolo ) lagarde : gre would be in better position if it had precautionary support , relationship with imf can still be helpful for country to move on
q : are african countries capable of raising debt in the financial markets and using the funds for valuable infrastructure projects ?
african countries have been very successful recently in issuing sovereign bonds , lagarde replies .
they are seen as safer bets than before .
and the imf plans to share its research on infrastructure spending , to ensure that the money is spent responsibly .

documents.title: lagarde calls on us congress to ratify imf changes
text: q : imf data shows that china will overtake the us as the world 's largest economy ( on a purchasing power basis ) , but it currently only has 4 % of the voting rights .
does that heighten the need to ratify changes to the imf 's governance ?
this is very important , christine lagarde agrees , fervently .
the us congress needs to approve legislation to change the make-up of the imf .
this was due in 2012 .
it is overdue in 2014 .
i hope it can be ratified under president obama 's leadership .

documents.title: christine lagarde 's q & a begins
text: here we go .
first question has n't the imf been calling for these structural reforms for a while ?
and is infrastructure spending now the best way forward ?
lagarde says the imf strongly supports the idea that infrastructure spending is used to promote growth , at a time when monetary policy is ensuring that credit is available at a very low cost .
it addresses the demand , and the supply side , of the economy .
and on structural reforms , lagarde agrees that this issue has been on the table for years .
it 's a question of doing it , not just talking about it .
christine lagarde in washington today reminder , christine lagarde 's press conference is online here .
she 'll take questions shortly - currently she 's running through the points mentioned earlier
christine lagarde is running through the imf 's announcements over the last couple of days ; growth forecasts cut , risks of a 'new mediocre ' , etc
christine lagarde is speaking at a press conference in washington now .
she starts by telling the room that , in an earlier meeting , she has announced that it 's ok for countries fighting ebola to widen their fiscal deficits .
lagarde admits that imf colleagues may not immediately support that policy , but it 's a sign that the imf can change and adapt , even at the age of 70 .

documents.title: the imf 's new policy priorities
text: here are the imf 's new policy recommendations included in christine lagarde 's new global policy agenda : imf global policy agenda priorities ( if it 's hard to read , this tweet could be easier ) it includes more support for economic demand in the euro area ( more qe , perhaps ?
) , and for the us to safeguard financial stability '' ( when it starts to tighten monetary policy )

documents.title: lagarde : geopolitical tensions have intensified
text: christine lagarde also warns that geopolitical tensions could undermine the already brittle recovery .
she cites the conflict in ukraine , turmoil in the middle east , and the outbreak of ebola as factors that could hampering recovery in affected countries , and hurt confidence elsewhere .
while the impact of the conflict in ukraine has been relatively contained to date , further escalation could generate significant negative spillovers , both regionally and globally .
these would include disruptions in commodity prices , higher risk aversion in financial markets , and erosion of business confidence in trading partners .
meanwhile , developments in the mena region could trigger a sharp rise in global energy prices .
finally , a significant expansion of the ebola outbreak to other countries would pose a significant risk to growth in sub-saharan africa .

documents.title: christine lagarde : it 's a brittle , mediocre recovery
text: in her new global policy agenda , christine lagarde is spelling out that a brittle , mediocre recovery continues .
the envisaged acceleration in economic activity has again failed to materialize .
despite massive and welcome monetary support in major advanced economies and slowing fiscal consolidation , the recovery remains uneven and sluggish .
growth , and hence policy advice , are increasingly divergent across countries .

inflation is still below target in many advanced economies and is a growing concern in the euro area , while unemployment has stayed high there are some country-specific factors , including last winter 's bad weather in the us , and the ukraine crisis but still the continued weakness of investment and economic activity

documents.title: lagarde calls for `` bold and resolutely executed policies '' to help global economy
text: breaking : christine lagarde , head of the international monetary fund , is calling on politicians and policymakers to do more to stimulate growth and avoid the global economy hitting trouble again .
speaking in washington now , lagarde is demanding bold and resolutely executed policies '' to ward off the danger of long-term mediocre growth , with unacceptably low job creation and inclusion '' .

lagarde wants to see 1 ) structural reforms to boost growth , help confidence , and create jobs 2 ) stronger regulation and policy frameworks to prevent the flow of easy money '' destabilising the financial markets 3 ) more international 'coherence ' to avoid avoid exacerbating existing distortions , particularly regarding financial stability and global imbalance .
more to follow
heads-up .
international monetary fund managing director christine lagarde is due to hold a press briefing in a few minutes to discuss the global agenda for this week 's imf/world bank meeting .
it 's being streamed live here .
christine lagarde ( @ lagarde ) join me at 10:00a edt for my press briefing to discuss the global agenda for our annual meetings this week .
katerina sokou ( @ katerinasokou ) stay tuned for lagarde press briefing in a while .
it should be quite interesting , given the last three @ twitterid reports seeing trouble

here 's more gloomy analysis of the slump in german exports in august ( down an alarming 5.8 % month-on-month ) , from richard grieveson of the economist intelligence unit : coming on the back of the recent plunge in industrial output , this is another disastrous number that tallies with our long-held view that the german economy would suffer badly from euro zone weakness , the exchange of sanctions between the eu and russia , and slower growth in china .
there are reasons to think that the august export and industry numbers are a bit overstated given the strong july readings , but overall the negative trend is painfully clear .
we will need a very strong set of data for september it 's hard to see how any of the factors driving the weakness in german industry and exports will disappear in the next 2-3 quarters .

things may well get worse before they get better , and the feed-through channels of external weakness to the domestic economy are pretty clear , given the importance of export-orientated industry for german employment and growth overall .
germany 's ever-growing importance to aggregate euro zone growth ( with the exception of q2 ) indicates that things could get very messy in the bloc in the next few quarters .

pressure for monetary and ( german ) fiscal action to alleviate the downturn will increase , but politically we think the ecb has reached its limit , and higher public spending or investment in germany will be strongly resisted domestically ''
allie renison ( @ allierenison ) schäuble to british moderator : `` the uk should join the eurozone - it would be much better for you ''
yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) schäuble : i do n't like the word 'austerity ' , i prefer 'fiscal discipline ' .
lol
update : wolfgang schäuble is making those comments about german growth during an event at bertelsmann foundation - here 's a livestream .

documents.title: german finance minister : we must fight for more growth
text: some quotes from germany 's finance minister , wolfgang schäuble , are flashing up on the reuters terminal .
schäuble , who is in washington for the imf/world bank meetings , is acknowledging that europe has a growth problem ( a problem that is now lapping at germany 's doorstep ) .
but he is also insisting that budget rules ca n't simply be torn up ; a blow to hopes that germany could give eurozone neighbours more leeway .

here are the newsflashes : germany 's schaeuble says some risks affect germany more than other euro zone countries germany 's schaeuble says now we have to fight for more growth in europe , will have discussions in coming days germany 's schaeuble says europe will be asked to do more on growth , all agree schaeuble : if we do n't stick to the eu budget rules , monetary union does n't work schaeuble : germany is engine of growth in euro zone , we stick to 1.5 pct schaeuble : we have to give more priority to investment

from athens , correspondent helena smith writes that the news of riot dog loukanikos 's death could mark the end of one of greece 's most turbulent periods - if the greek prime minister is to be believed , anyway .

antonis samaras , currently in milan for a conference addressing the every worsening problem of unemployment in europe , has told reporters during his visit that the debt-stricken country is now on the path to growth .
he also feels 'absolutely confident and very comfortable '' about greece now exiting its eu-imf bailout programme .
wall street is taking carl icahn 's dear tim '' letter in its stride financial acrobat ( @ finansakrobat ) apple only up 0.8 % in pre market after borderline delusional icahn letter .

documents.title: carl icahn urges apple to accelerate share buybacks
text: carl icahn .

/nbcu photo bank via getty images activist investor carl icahn has called on the board of apple to speed up its share buyback scheme , before other investors realised that the company is undervalued .

in an open letter to the company , icahn starts by praising ceo tim cook and colleagues : as a large apple shareholder with approximately 53 million shares , we applaud you and the rest of management , especially in light of recent launches and announcements which further validate our view that you are the ideal ceo for apple i 'm sure cook is suitably chuffed .
but icahn goes on !
arguing that apple is really worth a mighty $ 203 per share today , not the $ 100.98 at which it closed last night .

so , icahn wants cook to put apple 's cash pile to work to buy back shares - driving up the value of other stakes ( such as his own , naturally ) : therefore , given the persistently excessive liquidity of $ 133 billion net cash on apple 's balance sheet , we ask you to present to the rest of the board our request for the company to make a tender offer , which would meaningfully accelerate and increase the magnitude of share repurchases .

icahn outlines how apple has a gloriously bright future , thanks to the iphone , apple pay , even the apple watch ( there 's a flurry of rather optimistic predictions on future product growth ) and icahn concludes by sounding a teensy bit impatient , predicting that lesser investors without his nose for opportunity will probably pile into apple sooner or later with more and more funds flowing from mutual funds to index funds ( because mutual funds have consistently failed to outperform ) the last thing they will want to see is their underperformance exacerbated by remaining underweight apple as it continues to outperform .

as the strength of the earnings growth we forecast materializes , and these funds scramble to correct this mistake , only to find themselves competing in the market to do so , a de facto short squeeze may occur , and we can only hope that the company has repurchased all the shares it can before that happens .
business insider has uploaded the whole letter .
jay yarow ( @ jyarow ) carl icahn 's letter to apple is out : tim , you 're an awesome ceo , but

documents.title: more good us jobs data
text: here comes the weekly us unemployment data and the number of people filing new jobless benefits claims has fallen again , by 1,000 to 287,000 .
the four-week average of initial claims also fell , to 287,750 , the lowest since february 2006 .

world first ( @ world first ) u.s. jobless claims four-week average lowest since feb. 2006 the 'continued claims ' total ( people filing jobless claims for at least their second week running ) , also fell .
it hit 2,381m , the lowest since may 2006 .
another sign that america 's labour market is in much better shape than europe 's .
but that , of course , raises the question of when the federal reserve will bite the bullet and start raising interest rates .
so , is george osborne right to say that britain is already being affected by the eurozone ?
well , there certainly are signs that the strong uk recovery seen earlier this year has faded a little .
on tuesday , for example , the niesr thinktank predicted that uk gdp rose by 0.7 % in the third quarter of 2014 , down from 0.9 % in april-june ( we get the official reading in two weeks ) .
the monthly pmi surveys showed that growth in the uk private sector slowed to a six-month low in september .
and july 's trade data showed that 95 % of britain 's export growth was to countries outside the eu .
europe 's economy , meanwhile , has certainly weakened .
its private sector virtually stagnated last month , led by the weak french economy .
eurozone gdp stagnated in the april-june quarter ( when germany fell into recession ) , and may have grown by only 0.2 or 0.3 % in q3 .
that 's too weak to make a dent in europe 's unemployment crisis , and would also have a knock-on effect on uk firms .
gavin hewitt ( @ bbcgavinhewitt ) in a bbc int britain 's chancellor of ex osborne calls on ecb to help eurozone economy .
says its weakness already affecting british economy

here are some more newsflashes from george osborne 's warning about the eurozone ; the chancellor appears to be chivvying the european central bank to do more : uk 's osborne says britain already being affected by weakness in euro zone uk 's osborne says uk better placed to weather economic storm due to action taken over last 4 years -bbc uk 's osborne says needs ecb to do its part to help euro zone economy -bbc

documents.title: osborne : uk is n't immune to problems in the eurozone
text: chancellor of the exchequer george osborne , earlier this month thomond for the guardian./christopher thomond uk chancellor george osborne has warned that the weakening eurozone economy is already hurting the uk .
speaking to the bbc , at the start of the imf 's meeting in washington , osborne warned that britain is n't immune '' from events in europe .
here are the key quotes ( via pa ) : this is a critical moment for the british economy .
the eurozone risks slipping back into crisis .
britain can not be immune from that .

it 's already having an impact on our manufacturing and our exports , '' osborne adds that britain need n't panic : we need to send clear message out around the world that we have a stable economy , that our economic plan is working , and that we are not going to deviate from that economic plan so that people around the world know that , while britain is not immune from what is going on the world , we can take steps to protect ourselves . ''

robert peston ( @ peston ) chancellor warns uk is past peak of growth in this phase of recovery , in interview with me , blames eurozone osborne 's warning comes amid a blizzard of bad economic news from the eurozone .
earlier this week , the imf cut its growth forecasts for germany , france and italy , and warned that the eurozone was a key risk to the recovery .
as we 've been covering this morning , economists are concerned that germany could be falling into recession .
exports plunging in august at their fastest rate since january 2009 ( see opening post ) , and factory orders and production also suffered alarming declines .
four of germany 's most important economic forecasters have also predicted today that the economy stagnated in the last quarter .

the institutes ( ifo of munich , diw of berlin , rwi of essen and iwh of halle ) warned : after gross domestic product contracted in the second quarter and likely stagnated in the third quarter , the economic engine is finding it difficult to get going . ''
we have to wait a fortnight to find out how many bank of england policymakers ( if any ) wanted to raise interest rates at this week 's meeting .

ihs global insight 's howard archer reckons the mpc was split 7-2 , for the third month running : we doubt that any more mpc members joined martin weale and ian mccafferty in voting for an interest rate hike at the october meeting .
there has been little indication that any of the other seven mpc members are leaning towards an immediate tightening of policy .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) the @ twitterid decision itself actually happened yday as three mpc members ( carney , shafik & cunliffe ) came out to dc last night for imf
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) least surprising news of day : @ twitterid leaves rates and qe unchanged

documents.title: bank of england leaves interest rates unchanged .
text: the bank of england has voted to leave uk interest rates unchanged at 0.5 % .
that means borrowing costs have been at their current record low since march 2009 .
it has also left its quantitiative easing programme unchanged , at £ 375bn .
no surprises there .

documents.title: greek riot dog passes away
text: from 2012 , riot dog 'loukanikos ' standing in front of a line of riot police .
scarff/getty images sad news from greece - loukanikos , the valiant dog who faced down greek riot police during the height of the eurozone crisis , has died .
greek media report that loukanikos ( greek for sausage ) passed away peacefully , having retired from protests in 2012 .
curiously , there are also reports that poor loukanikos may have died a few months ago , but it 's only just come to light menelaos tzafalias ( @ tzaf ) corr .
: checked with the family that took care of athens riot dog # loukanikos .
the dog died last may , not recently .
cc @ twitterid | # greece loukanikos began hitting the headlines in 2010 , when the stray hound began appearing in the front line of anti-austerity protests .
athens journalist damian mac con uladh reports that loukanikos suffered from his years on the front line .

according to avgi journalist petros katsakos , the dog 's health was adversely affected by tear gas and from being kicked from police , forcing him to retire '' from active protest about two years ago .
he was on the couch sleeping , when suddenly his heart stopped beating , '' loukanikos ' carer told avgi .
full story here , in greek .
at the height of his fame , loukanikos even featured in time magazine 's review of 2011 ( full details ) .
loukanikos 'retired ' in autumn 2012 , around the time that the eurozone crisis was easing .
he swapped tear gas and riot shields for a gentler life with an athens family , who offered all the care , love , food and vaccinations '' a dog could could need .
and now , as the dawn newspaper puts it , he 's resting in the shade of a tree on a hill in the centre of the capital '' .

here 's some reaction to his death : damian mac con uladh ( @ damomac ) loukanikos , # greece 's famous riot dog , breathes his last asteris masouras 正义 ( @ asteris ) i 'm touched to see foreign corros remember loukanikos .
# greece 's stray dogs loved by most everyone ( except the sick thugs who poison them ) .
sara firth ( @ sara firth ) # athen 's much loved riot dog # loukanikos ( sausage ) has reportedly died .
rip little friend # greece wo n't forget you .
mehran khalili ( @ mkhalili ) shot i took of 'riot dog ' loukanikos resting in front of parliament at sunset in october 2011 .
rip old boy .
# greece tom mcarthur ( @ tommcarthur ) 'sausage ' was greece 's riot dog who faced down cops at many athens anti-austerity protests

one of the european central bank 's favoured measures of inflation expectations just hit a new all-time low : gregor peter ( @ l0gg0l ) $ $ eurozone 5y5y swaps hit new low at 1.88 % ( via @ twitterid )

documents.title: greece falls deeper into deflation
text: elstat has also reported that prices continued to fall in greece last month , and at a faster pace .
the greek consumer prices index fell to -0.8 % in september , showing that deflation accelerated after august 's -0.3 % .
the decline was even sharper , -1.1 % , when measured on an eu-harmonised basis .
this means that prices have now fallen for the last 19 months in a row , as wages and pensions have shrunk amid its austerity programme .
this chart shows greek cpi ( the blue line ) since the start of 2012 .
a clear deflationary trend.. and this chart shows how food , clothing , and education costs have all fallen over the last year , while healthcare costs have risen .
greek inflation , to september 2014
and here 's a chart showing how greece 's labour market has changed over the last year : greek unemployment , to july 2014 ( the full report is here )

documents.title: greek unemployment rate falls to 26.4 %
text: just in : greece 's unemployment rate has fallen , but still remains extremely high .
the jobless rate dipped to 26.4 % in july , down from 26.7 % in june .
that 's the lowest rate since the spring of 2012 .
greek unemployment , to july 2014 elstat reports that the number of greek people in work increased by 34,218 in july .
the number of people unemployed fell by 12,212 .
and the number of people classed as 'inactive ' ( and outside the labour force ) fell by 26,760 .
elstat also reported that the jobless rate for those between 15 and 24 was 50.7 % , down from 58.2 % a year ago .
heads-up .
activist investor carl icahn has promised to release an interesting '' open letter to apple today .
carl icahn ( @ carl c icahn ) tmrw we 'll be sending an open letter to @ twitterid cook .
believe it will be interesting .
could he be planning to chivvy apple ceo tim cook to release some of the tech giant 's cash pile , having make a large paper profit on his shares in the company ?
carl icahn ( @ carl c icahn ) just over 1yr ago we tweeted our large position in $ aapl & belief the company extremely undervalued .
since then , stock is up 50.6 %
holger sandte , euro economist at nordea markets , is less pessimistic than ing about the german economy .
sandte reckons germany can avoid slipping into recession , if exports and private consumption rebound in september after the august slowdown .
holger sandte ( @ holgersandte ) # gdp decline in # germany in q3 far from done deal : foreign trade and consumption could save the quarter .
plus some industrial rebound in sep we 'll find out whose right next month

the slide in german exports shows how geopolitics is hurting europe 's economy , says kit juckes , foreign exchange expert at societe generale : soft german export data really hammer home the impact of the ukraine crisis on the heart of europe 's economy .
we 're going to see more of this , and mounting pressure on the ecb to act .
nothing good for the euro here , needless to say .
here 's a couple more charts , putting the 5.8 % tumble in german exports ( details start here ) into context : .
/ @ nr zero chris williamson ( @ williamsonchris ) # germany 's exports -5.8 % in aug after +4.8 % july .
still running +2 % in q3 v q2 but pmi signals more weakness to come

documents.title: european markets rally after the fed
text: the roller-coaster ride in the stock markets continues .
europe 's stock markets are all rallying in early trading , after last night 's federal reserve minutes were more dovish than expected .
the realisation that the fed may be further from raising rates than expected has pushed the ftse 100 up 51 points , or 0.8 % , at 6,534 .
and traders in frankfurt are n't fretting about germany 's export slump ; the dax is up around 1.2 % .
here 's the details : european stock markets , 8.45am bst , october 9th reuters
peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) if only there were a german word for those taking pleasure in # germany 's sudden economic downturn
german government debt is strengthening again this morning , driving down the yield ( or interest rate ) on 10-year bunds to just 0.88 % .
that 's a remarkable low yield - in comparison , uk 10-year gilts are yielding 2.21 % .
that shows nervous investors are valuing safety over profits , and also anticipating further weak growth and low inflation in the euro area .
a repeat of japan 's lost decades ?
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) my japanification chart becomes more scary by the day .
10yr bund yld drops to 0.88 % following japan experience of 90s
in the uk , the clampdown on payday lenders continues .
the competition and markets authority ( cma ) has announced that such firms must put the products on display on price comparison websites .
it 's worried that , without transparency , all lenders will simply charge the highest repayment rate permissible .
full story : payday loans shaken up by competition regulator
it appears that the slump in german exports was partly due to weak demand from outside europe .

this chart shows how exports to 'third countries ' , was 4.7 % lower in august than a year ago : ( alas , there 's not a month-on-month number ) german exports nordea markets ' aurelija augulyte suggests the roots of germany 's downturn lie elsewhere aurelija augulyte ( @ auaurelija ) so who has a problem , germany or ?

jamie mcgeever of reuters sums up why august was a cruel month for germany : jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) august was a pretty dire month for german economy : industrial orders -5.7 % , industrial output -4.0 % , exports -5.8 % .
all worst in 5+ years

documents.title: ing : germany needs 'small miracle ' to avoid recession
text: ing 's carsten brzeski says germany will need a small miracle '' to avoid sliding into recession .

august 's slide in exports , along with unexpectedly poor industrial production and factory orders , suggest an extremely sharp stand-still in august '' he writes : no more summer miracle but rather a summer horror story in germany .
august trade data just added to the devastating evidence that the entire german economy took a pause in august .
why ?
brzeski points to the slowdown in many of germany 's key exports markets , the ukraine crisis , and the late german summer holidays .
but it 's still not easy to explain .
and he 's gloomy about future prospects : looking ahead , this week 's german data show that in spite of the soccer miracle in the summer , there definitely wo n't be any economic miracle .
on the contrary , the economy seems to need a small miracle in september to avoid a recession in the third quarter .
carsten brzeski ( @ carstenbrzeski ) no more sommermaerchen but rather a german summer horror story .
exports dive by 5.8 % mom , strongest decline since jan 2009 .
noah barkin ( @ noahbarkin ) a rather stunning 5.8 pct drop in # german exports in august .
sharpest fall since jan 2009 ( though summer vacation effects played a role )
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) starting the day w/ poor german data : # germany exports fell by -5.8 % mom , biggest monthly drop since jan2010 .

documents.title: german exports suffer biggest plunge since january 2009
text: germany has suffered another dose of bad economic news ; exports have fallen at their fastest rate since the early months of the financial crisis .
german exports tumbled by 5.8 % month-on-month in august , data released by the federal statistics office shows .
that 's the biggest fall since january 2009 .
imports also shrank , by 1.3 % .
german exports ( ausfuhr ) and imports ( einfuhr ) it adds to fears that europe 's largest economy hit trouble over the summer , dragged back by the weakness of the wider eurozone economy .
economists had expected a 4 % drop in exports , and a 1 % rise in imports .
the slump in exports narrowed germany 's trade surplus , to €17.5bn from €22.2bn ( on a seasonally-adjusted basis ) .
it 's the third piece of bad economic news from germany this week !
factory production and new orders , both fell sharply in august .
todd buell ( @ toddbuell ) `` sharpest fall since january 2009 '' seems to be the new style .
german exports tank 5.8 % in august .
bad things come in 3s .
one factor is that german summer holidays were later than usual , meaning more of a slowdown in august .

but there 's no argument that the country 's economy struggled during the month reaction to follow angela cullen ( @ cullenang ) german exports plunged 5.8 % in august , biggest drop since january 2009

documents.title: the agenda : dovish fed drives markets up
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and finance .
a relief rally is sweeping the markets today , after the us central bank revealed it is not as close to hiking interest rates as investors had expected .

minutes of the fed 's last meeting , released last night , showed concerns that the strength of the us dollar will drag back growth , and also keep inflation below target , that triggered a strong rally on wall street , as investors who 'd expected more hawkish words from the fed got a very nasty shock .
traders on the floor of the new york stock exchange yesterday , where the dow jumped by 274 points .
burton/getty images asian markets have jumped , and europe is expected to follow when trading begins , reversing some recent losses .

stan shamu of ig reports : after a long period of underperformance as markets priced in a greater possibility of a rate hike , the fed minutes seem to have 'temporarily ' poured cold water on this notion and given some relief to struggling equities .
the main points from the minutes were that the fed downgraded its growth outlook slightly in the short and medium term due to a stronger projected usd and a slower rate of home price appreciation .
additionally risks to global growth will be a factor and inflation forecasts were revised down a touch .

however , the fundamentals of the global economy haven ' t suddenly improved , and europe in particular looks to be weak and with four fed policymakers due to speak today , giving their own take on the situation , it could be a lively time in the markets .
also coming up today the bank of england 's monetary policy committee is meeting this morning to set interest rates .
the mpc is not expected to make any changes ; given wage growth in the uk is still weak , and there are signs that the economy may be slowing .
we get the decision at noon .
the weekly us jobless data comes at 1.30pm bst .

ecb president mario draghi is speaking at the brookings institute in new york , at 4pm bst ( 11 am washington ) and the imf 's autumn meeting continues ; fund chief christine lagarde is expected to outline her policy agenda at 3pm bst ( 10am washington ) .
